greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = binomial(3n,n) mod (n+1).
comment: These divisibilities are analogous to those of Catalan numbers. For rather long sequences of consecutive integers, a(n)=0. For the first 10000 integers 9678 residues equals zero. See A118113.
If n+1 is in A061345, a(n)=0. This follows from Kummer's theorem. - _Robert Israel_, May 09 2018
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 13 2006
ext: Mathematica program corrected by _Harvey P. Dale_, Dec 28 2012
